channel.title: Firefox
channel.description: Okay, so I had to re-format because I'm retarded, and I backed up my whole Firefox folder (From Program Files), so how do I get all my bookmarks, password and such back from that folder into my freshly installed version?

item.title: Firefox
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“runescape3dude, post:7, topic:276249”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=364814.msg2770178#msg2770178 date=1241058418]

Aren’t those settings in ApplicationData directory in XP?

They are, so if you only backed up the program files directory you lost everything.

And all you have to do is put your profile folder in the correct folder and restart firefox.

However, next time use foxmarks (I think they changed their name to xmarks) and it stores your bookmarks and (optionally) passwords on a server so you never use them, and most importantly for me, they are the same across all machines and operating systems.
[/quote]
Saving the passwords on a server doesn’t sound too safe to me…[/quote]

That’s what I thought originally too, but I looked into it and it’s safe. Actually it only sends encrypted versions of the passwords to the server, the password to decrypt them is only stored on your computer, so no one on the server side ever gets your password.

In addition, if you are really paranoid about it, the plugin gives the option for you to set up your own server where your data is stored, that way you control everything.

Read full topic

They are, so if you only backed up the program files directory you lost everything.

And all you have to do is put your profile folder in the correct folder and restart firefox.

However, next time use foxmarks (I think they changed their name to xmarks) and it stores your bookmarks and (optionally) passwords on a server so you never use them, and most importantly for me, they are the same across all machines and operating systems.
[/quote]
Saving the passwords on a server doesn’t sound too safe to me…[/quote]

Then get the password exporter plugin…

@moparisthebest wrote:

T4_:

Aren’t those settings in ApplicationData directory in XP?

They are, so if you only backed up the program files directory you lost everything.

And all you have to do is put your profile folder in the correct folder and restart firefox.

However, next time use foxmarks (I think they changed their name to xmarks) and it stores your bookmarks and (optionally) passwords on a server so you never use them, and most importantly for me, they are the same across all machines and operating systems.
